other_tests.findings: Microscopical examination showed hyperplastic islets of Langerhans in large areas of the sections from the uncinate process and in slightly smaller areas of the sections from the body and tail. The islets varied greatly in size, with some giant islets (more than 250 Âµm in diameter) containing many enlarged cells with hyperchromatic nuclei; microscopical features are consistent with the presence of hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia with diffuse islet-cell hyperplasia.
Microscopical examination confirmed findings of hyperplastic islets of Langerhans consistent with diffuse islet-cell hyperplasia.
Microscopical examination confirmed the findings on frozen-section examination with the removal of 90 to 95 percent of her pancreas.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The infant still had hypoglycemia that required the intravenous administration of large quantities of glucose in the following days and weeks.
